gw.bc.invoice.entity

Interface Invoice

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Bean, com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider, java.lang.Comparable<Bean>, Editable, EventAware, com.guidewire.pl.domain.messaging.gen.EventAwareStubI, IGosuObject, InCurrencySilo, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.InCurrencySiloStubI, com.guidewire.bc.domain.invoice.gen.InvoiceStubI, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, KeyableBean, Retireable, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, com.guidewire.pl.system.entity.Subtype, com.guidewire.pl.system.entity.SubtypeBean, Validatable, com.guidewire.pl.domain.validation.gen.ValidatableStubI, Versionable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccountInvoice, com.guidewire.bc.domain.invoice.gen.AccountInvoiceStubI, StatementInvoice, com.guidewire.bc.domain.invoice.gen.StatementInvoiceStubI

    public interface Invoice
extends com.guidewire.bc.domain.invoice.gen.InvoiceStubI
    Invoice A container for invoice items for Accounts and Producers.

    • Method Detail

      • maybeRecalcAmounts

        void maybeRecalcAmounts()
        Recalculates denormalized fields on the Invoice if the fields need recalculating. Generally this method does not need to be called, since it will be called in InsertCallback or UpdateCallback methods, but if you are making changes to an Invoice in a pre-update rule, you will need to call this method to ensure that all consistency checks pass.

      • getDate

        java.util.Date getDate()
        Alias for InvoiceStubI.getEventDate().
        Returns:
        the event (or bill) date of the invoice

      • getDueDate

        java.util.Date getDueDate()
        Alias for InvoiceStubI.getPaymentDueDate().
        Returns:
        the due date of the invoice

      • getInvoicePeriodCutoff

        java.util.Date getInvoicePeriodCutoff()
        return the actual date and time that the invoice period ends for the given invoice. The cutoff date is calculated using the invoice's event date, combined with the "InvoicePeriodCutoff" server parameter, which defines for the application the time of day an invoice period ends.
        Returns:
        the cutoff date

      • getInvoicePeriodDueCutoff

        java.util.Date getInvoicePeriodDueCutoff()
        return the actual date and time that the invoice period due ends for the given invoice. The cutoff date is calculated using the invoice's due date, combined with the "InvoicePeriodDueCutoff" server parameter, which defines for the application the time of day an invoice period due ends.
        Returns:
        the invoice period due cutoff date

      • getEndOfEventDateDay

        java.util.Date getEndOfEventDateDay()
        Returns:
        the invoice's event date advanced to 12:59:59pm. This date is useful for calculating balances at the end of the invoice's event date day, at which point invoice processing most likely will have taken place.

      • isNextPlannedInvoice

        boolean isNextPlannedInvoice()
        Returns:
        true if the specified invoice is the next planned invoice (after this one) on the invoice's owner (either Account or Producer)

      • isPaid

        boolean isPaid()
        Returns:
        true if the invoice has been paid, namely if Invoice.AmountDue is not positive.

      • isSent

        boolean isSent()
        Returns:
        true if the invoice has been sent in Direct Bill, i.e. if its status is "Billed" or "Due", or if the statement has been sent (for Agency Bill) via the workflow.

      • isBilledOrDue

        boolean isBilledOrDue()
        Returns:
        true if the invoice is in either BILLED (aka Open) or DUE state, regardless of payment status.

      • isBilled

        boolean isBilled()
        Returns:
        true if this invoice is in the BILLED state, regardless of payment status.

      • isDue

        boolean isDue()
        Returns:
        true if this invoice is in the DUE state

      • isPlanned

        boolean isPlanned()
        Returns:
        trueif this invoice is in the PLANNED state

      • isPayable

        boolean isPayable()
        Returns:
        true if this invoice is BILLED or DUE and has not been fully paid.

      • makeBilled

        java.util.List<ChargeInvoicingTxn> makeBilled()
        Performs the billing action on this invoice. This is the same action that the Invoice batch process does. Handles pushing held items forward, writeoffs, etc. For Agency Bill, initiates the Agency Bill Workflow.
        Returns:
        a list of the ChargeInvoicingTxn transactions (ChargeBilled) created as part of billing this invoice.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current state of this invoice is not PLANNED

      • createBilledTransactions

        java.util.List<ChargeInvoicingTxn> createBilledTransactions()
        For each invoice item on this invoice, create the billed transaction using InvoiceItem.onInvoiceBilled(). This method should be used in configuration code (pre-update rules, most likely) when the invoice items need to be billed, in accounting terms, before the invoice that they are on is actually sent out. A likely scenario is when a large negative charge comes in, and that charge should "pay" future positive charges immediately. See CC-44923 for background.
        Returns:
        the list of Charge Invoicing Transactions created

      • createDueTransactions

        java.util.List<ChargeDue> createDueTransactions()
        For each invoice item on this invoice, create the due transaction using InvoiceItem.doDueTransaction(). This method should be used in configuration code (pre-update rules, most likely) when the invoice items need to be made due, in accounting terms, before the invoice that they are on is actually sent out. A likely scenario is when a large negative charge comes in, and that charge should "pay" future positive charges immediately. See CC-44923 for background.


        WARNING: Do Not Use This To Make An Invoice Billed! Use the makeBilled() method instead.

        Returns:
        the Charge Due transactions that were created.

      • getPolicies

        PolicyPeriod[] getPolicies()
        Returns:
        the Policy Periods that have invoice items on this invoice.

      • addFees

        void addFees()
        Adds invoice and/or installment fees to this invoice.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns:
        true if statement is closed

      • getPayer

        InvoicePayer getPayer()
        Returns:
        either an Account(Direct Bill) or a Producer(Agency Bill)

      • getInvoiceItemsWithoutCommissionRemainder

        InvoiceItem[] getInvoiceItemsWithoutCommissionRemainder()
        Returns the items on this invoice, excluding any commission remainder items.
        Returns:
        the filtered list of invoice items

      • setInvoiceNumber

        void setInvoiceNumber()
        Allocate and set the InvoiceNumber for this invoice if not already set. Note allocation must serialize so invocation will limit throughput. Also, allocation is permanent so if not persisted invocation will use up allocation to no purpose.
